text: Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear...
And whoever fears Allah – He will make for him a way out and provide for him from where he does not expect.
So do not lose heart nor fall into despair, for you will be superior if you are true in faith.
Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer – We will surely cause him to live a good life.
For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease. Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage, and [then] your strength would depart.
O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.
And those who strive for Us – We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
And your Lord says, Call upon Me; I will respond to you.
Say, O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah.
Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we forget or make a mistake.
And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'
So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship]. And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good – then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold.
Say, 'Never will we be struck except by what Allah has decreed for us; He is our protector.'
Is not Allah sufficient for His Servant? Yet they threaten you with those they worship other than Him.
Whatever of good reaches you, is from Allah, but whatever of evil befalls you, is from yourself.
Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah – He will guide his heart.
And whoever fears Allah – He will make for him of his matter ease.
Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him?
Go forth, whether light or heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of Allah.
But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter.
And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive [to Allah].
And rely upon Allah; and sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.
Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance.
My Lord, increase me in knowledge.
Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil?
And those who strive for Us – We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing.
Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand.
Indeed, Allah confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so].
And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them.
And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet in return with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner].
Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is in one who believes in Allah.
Help one another in acts of righteousness and piety, but do not help one another in sin and transgression.
Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge? And He found you lost and guided [you].
Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing.
And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong.
